p: Leaf extracts from Moringa oleifera showed anti-herpetic activity and were reported to successfully inhibit the growth of HSV-1 and 2 in Vero cells by 43.2 and 21.4%, respectively [ 56]. Ethanolic leaf extracts of Moringa oleifera were also reported to have anti-influenza activity in vitro [ 57]. A 1998 study by Murakami and colleagues reported that niaziminin, a thiocarbamate, 4-[(4′-O-acetyl-alpha-L-rhamnosyloxy)benzyl] isothyanate (ITC) and allyl- and benzyl-ITC (two isothyanate-related compounds), were all able to inhibit Epstein–Barr virus (EBV) in vitro [ 58]. Figure 12 shows the chemical structures of niaziminin, allyl-ICT, and benzyl-ICT.
